replies.body: When did gaming stop being about fun?

Well yeah, but gaming wasn't always about being the best. It was about having fun and exploring around new worlds. I remember playing Mario Party with my siblings and cousins, and while we competed, it was still for fun. Wasn't super serious, and we laughed the entire time.

Nowadays people are treating it like life or death, or a job, which just feels wrong.

That's because "fun" is different for every person.

Example being for me... Fun is Winning. Ruin my chances at winning, ruin my fun.

But like i said, it's a different meaning for everyone


Side note: Mario party is the worst example as that game has ruined more friendships that created in it's lifetime LOL XD

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

It's fun until people consider something on the line be it money, pride, respect, etc. They can still have fun playing the game (just look at when pros stream), but when they're on stage and in-game, they need to be focused on what's at stake.
